profileText: (Uncle of Richard Biddle), a Delegate from Pennsylvania; born in Philadelphia, Pa., in 1738; entered the provincial army as an ensign in 1754, promoted to lieutenant and captain, and served until 1763, when he resigned; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Reading, Pa.; member of the State assembly 1767-1775, serving as speaker in 1774; member of the provincial convention held at Philadelphia in 1775; again a member of the State assembly in 1778; Member of the Continental Congresses in 1774 and 1775; died at Chatsworth, near Baltimore, Md., September 5, 1779; interment in St. Paul's Churchyard, Baltimore, Md.

researchRecord.name: In the Northamton County Papers, ca. 1682-1887, 27 linear feet.
In the Nicholas Biddle Papers, ca. 1681-1933, 39.2 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Edward Biddle. A finding aid for the papers is available in the repository.
